website_summaries.verdict: This spice and coffee grinder has separate wet and dry cups and features a transparent lid so you can keep an eye on the texture.
pros: 2 removable cups with stainless steel blade
Includes grinder blade and chopping blade
Only operates when top cover is in place
Transparent lid lets you see how well ingredients are blending
Chops ginger, nutmeg and wet almonds without problems
cons: Use grinding motor for 30 seconds at a time, then wait a minute to resume, to avoid damaging the motor

customer_reviews.title: If you use this for wet ingredients you will take a chance of food poisoning  this is not NSF safe!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly the photograph of guacamole is so misrepresenting of what this can and cannot do. I processed avocado it leaked into the lid under the stainless steel cosmetic cap that is non-removable. Also the blade assembly leaked from underneath. And lastly the design of the top cover is so sloppy as to an accurate placement to operate the device. There are by far better grinders on the market for both wet or dry. This is another example of a china made product lacking the quality that an American-made product can stand behind. w w w.nsf.org /consumer- resources/ what-is-nsf-certification
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice little machine
customer_reviews.text: We have only used this once so far but it really seems like it will do whatever we need. We grind peanuts to make our own peanut butter and it worked like a charm. The deciding factor for us was that there are two small bowls, one with a single blade and one with 2 blades. We figured the double blade would be best for grinding nuts. It worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Betty M

customer_reviews.title: I used this grinder the first time today and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this grinder the first time today and I grinded dehydrated vegetables. Well, I made 3 cups of the grinder attachments and I grinded about 3x 20 seconds. After the second cup the motor began to smell.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used it like 3-4 times and in middle of the wet grinding ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it like 3-4 times and in middle of the wet grinding it stopped and smelled something burning. Returning it! Bad quality!
customer_reviews.author: Mahesh Shimpi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent spice grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality grinder. I bought it to replace my spice grinder. This does an excellent job of grinding everything to a nice powder. The cup on top is large enough for several spices to be ground at once and does it very quickly. One cup is meant for moist applications and does pink pepper extremely well. Easy and fast clean up is a major plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine.!
customer_reviews.text: I tried it twice so far and it works really well.! I wish it was a little bigger in size of 3 cups or more.! I would like to suggest the manufacuturer to produce bigger size machine! I bought this mainly for grinding chutnies and ginger-garlic paste in a bulk quantity. So it is little too small for that purpose. But I still like it since it does a good job getting a small quantity done.!!
customer_reviews.author: Veenzi

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but lacks power
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s compact however it lacks strength for making things like chutney which is primarily the reason for my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shalini

customer_reviews.title: How long will it last?
customer_reviews.text: My window expired to return. I was willing to try it again and chalk this on up to unusually defective. After 3 times using the coffee bean grinder for coffee beans, the "on" feature when you place the lid on top and press....... it broke. Now in order to use it, I must ready the coffee beans, place the lid on, and plug it in the socket while holding my other hand over the machine so it doesn't move. I will soon look for a different model. Meanwhile, as in the title, : How long will it last ?
customer_reviews.author: ValP

customer_reviews.title: Love this grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder for grinding seeds and spices. It does a great job with little effort from the motor so it does not make a very loud sound while grinding. I am eating oatmeal with flax seeds, pumpkin seeds, and walnuts and this grinder is helping me to get all of it ground. It is easy to use and easy to clean. After I ground my seeds the other day my husband asked me to chop up some chicken so I changed to the chopper blade and it did a wonderful job. I will use it to make chicken salad when it is just for me.
customer_reviews.author: JoDolly

customer_reviews.title: This thing is FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a cuisinart grinder - lasted for several years and did just fine but the blade on that model was elevated a bit from the bottom of the grinder cup and had a plastic middle piece (that broke). This grinder solved my problems and grinds coffee MUCH better than my old grinder. The blades themselves lift slightly off the ginder cup bottom but the middle of the blade is secured to the grinder cup with metal, not plastic. EXCELLENT results thus far and highly recommend for the price. *Note* haven't even used the bonus chopper cup yet either. This thing really is top-notch.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: It is the worst grinder I have ever used. It works just ffine. However, when I grind my coffee beans for more than 20 seconds , it strats smoking that smoke affects the taste of my coffee. Dont be lured by its relatively low price and the good reviews, invest your money a good quality grinder, your cup of coffee worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this. Safety hazard.
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever. They don’t check their products before sending. It started smoking the moment we started it. Could have burnt my house down, disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Payal

customer_reviews.title: Apart from the lid the grinder is good. / Motor Burned after 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the product. It's small and easy to use. It doesn't even make loud noise (necessary feature when u have a baby). Lid cover is a lil weird though. It's not air tight and spits out chunks / residue when used. Updating my previous review - just like some people have mentioned in reviews, my motor burned after 3 months of very light use.
customer_reviews.author: Zoya

customer_reviews.title: Started smoking on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware on this one. I purchased as a spice grinder and it began smoking as if it was getting ready to catch fire on my first use. Wasn't grinding anything tough or difficult so that isn't the reason. Just junk in my opinion. Because I didn't use it within the "return window" I have to eat the cost, (and without the benefit of fresh spices to go on top.), so I am screwed. Not happy but I should have tried it as soon as it arrived. Just want to make sure no one else repeats my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Leithead

customer_reviews.title: small size, short time to achieve the fine result
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product to grind garlic, dry hot peper and coffee bean. We tried this several times so far so good. Because this is a small size grinder, it only takes about 20 seconds to finish the job each time. But the result coming out is fine. For small family and those who few cooking at home, this machine is right for you. It is also very easy to carry with you when you go to travel. It is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy1981

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use process, suitable for small nuts and chopped fruit.
customer_reviews.text: The Chulex grinder came with two bowls- A chopper and a grinder. I had orginally anticipated the machine to be smaller, but it was a tad bit larger. Following on, the grinder also had a plastic cup which went over the bowl, pushing down to start grinding. The noise quality is very low, and the grinder was stable throughout the whole process. Overall, I enjoyed this product as it was easy to clean- I do reccomend this product to be kept away from children, the machinery makes it easy for small fingers to get hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Zheng Famiy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, well constructed and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder was well constructed. The cups were easily twisted on and off. I ordered this because I had problem removing the top cover of my old one due to arthritis on my fingers which was a common design for most coffee grinders. Finally found this one and it could also a small chopper that I could chop onion ,garlic or ginger for my home cooking. The pretty design looks good with all my stainless steel kitchen appliances and small gadgets too. That is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: WM in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for 5 times. Then the motor burnt. Waste of money.so disappointing. Out of return period.
customer_reviews.author: valmydaughter

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: This Stopped working after 2 uses. Very disappointed with the product. Bought it with high expectations after seeing great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Shibin Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: It takes forever to grind things into a fine powder, I could deal with that.... But what I can't deal with is the spice powder getting EVERYWHERE. All over the lid, inside of the electrical compartments, everywhere. It makes cleaning ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sneha

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleansing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for grinding spices and making sauce as I have seen this done on cooking shows. It works very well for this and for the coffee bean also. The design is sleek and modern, the size is perfect for my needs, whether i keep it on the counter or stored away, takes no room at all. There also included a small cleanning brush.My neighbors are wanting to use it for themselves to grind. So I recommend them to choose this electric spice grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Liz pbz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a chopper or grinder that would be able to do a handful or two of coffee beans and spices, but also garlic and ginger.This was the perfect choice. It comes with 2 cups, the flatter blade cup for grinding dry food,the four-blade cup is for garlic, ginger, or other soft ingredients- like chopping veggies to make salsa or sauces. You have to pulse it for less than 30 seconds at a time, which I think is ideal for grinding anyway. I have done perfect coffee grounds with it.The bowls and cover are decent quality. I higher recommend this mini wet and dry electric grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Monica park

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Use it mostly for grinding our spices for curries & making our own chilli power. The 4-blade chopper cup is good for small amounts of chopping when you don't need a big chopper to do the job. overall a handy little thing to have in the kitchen for fresh grinds and pesto. Love that the containers are dishwasher safe and stainless steel.Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: leoho

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Works great the first month, easy to use, then progressively begins to fail. Electric motor overheats, smokes, and shuts off. After motor cools from normal use grinding coffee beans will it grind again for a short period. The design of attaching the grinding cup seems sturdy, simple to clean, but the electric motor can't hold up to frequent use. If the motor was upgraded to a more powerful one, this would be a nice coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectation
customer_reviews.text: I tested the dry and the wet cups on coffee and garlic. While coffee beans usually require a fancier and a higher-end grinder, this one came out pretty good, especially for cold brew coffee. The wet cup is one that I normally have problems with, especially with garlic, tends to stick on the wall, but no problem with this one! The cup is narrow enough to get the garlic ground pretty fine.
customer_reviews.author: XW California

customer_reviews.title: Weak product - low motor power, extremely small and weak parts.
customer_reviews.text: This is not intended for regular cooking. I tried to churn some peanuts - even after 5minutes they did not blend well. I am not sure if that will be case with coffee beans/nuts - which are about the same consistency. The motor power is too low. The parts are cheap and after the first use it started coming out - as shown in the picture i have attached. I returned it on the first day I got it and got a NUTRI BULLET 900 instead. HIGHLY RECOMMEND GETTING A 1200 WATT OR ATLEAST 900 WATT BLENDER., DEFINITELY NOT THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Rangarajan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used it to grind spices such as cumin and flaxseeds and it come to a fine powder(grinder cup). My coconut chutney(chopper cup) came out very good.Works well on small batches.However if it was a bit larger,with more capacity, it would have been better. Overall this is the compact wet and dry grinder so far.Clean up is a ease with a free small brush.
customer_reviews.author: Lily zhou

customer_reviews.title: Broke after an year of use
customer_reviews.text: Did not last more than a year. It works great but not very well built. The first one the grinding jar broke and now the motor unit has stopped working. When I connect to power a white smoke starts coming out and seems like something is burning. Seems like water went inside. I let it dry for few days but no luck. I will not buy again this same product.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting, poor commitment from manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in Sept 2019. In the beginning it worked well. In just around 6 months of infrequent usage(1-2 times a month) the grinder started giving problems. One of the bowl with 4-wing blades does not grind much now except tiny amount of content. Another bowl with 2-wing blades has a rubber gear at the bottom which fits into the rotor is split apart and is totally useless now. There seems to be a 1 year warranty but when I send an email to the provided email regarding my issues there was no response. So overall not happy with the product and the service and commitment from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Using it for freeze dried fruit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to grind freeze dried fruit. It works fantastic for that purpose. It's fast and grinds it completely into a powder in a very short period of time. I only give it 4 stars rather than 5 because it's not easy to clean. The flimsy little brush provided does not sweep that powder out--needs to be stiffer. Overall, I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Faith B

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I use this a couple of times a week and have done for the past six month. It's great for making ground spice mixes and pastes (I've used it to make Thai curry paste, Indian chutneys) as well as for grinding coffee beans and nuts. My only gripe was with the grinder bowl, the blade stopped spinning after about 3 or 4 months of use - however I noted the listing states a manufacturer warranty and contacted the sellers directly (chulux) - and within a couple of weeks they sent out a replacement grinder bowl from their factory in china. Cannot fault their customer service - I will buy again from them!
customer_reviews.author: Raheel616

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I use the grinder for my daily life. I've tried the wet and dry grinding cups and definitely do a great job with both. And It’s not excessively noisy for a grinder, easy to clean by removing the stainless cup and rinsing. It seems sturdy and made of quality materials. I hope it can last a long time. So far it works great. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grinder to grind small quantity pastes and spices. I cook with a lot of garlic, chili and other spices.I usually hand chopped before because of the cleaning needed for the food chopper is trouble. Until I searched the chulux mini grinder. I just throw the ingredients in and they are chopped in seconds.Ultra sharp blades and smooth operation. The important thing is easy to clean with the small brush. I find I'm using it far more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Xing Lin

customer_reviews.title: No Strength
customer_reviews.text: I own other grinders and have owned many. I bought this to grind almonds and coffee. The first time I tried to grind coffee beans one got stuck in the blades and it tore off the blade. I used it for another week with the other blade it comes with until that blade did the same thing. Tried to chop dates, they stopped the blade. Tried to chop raisins they stopped the blade too. This thing really can't grind anything other than herbs. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Palmer

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is replacing my older one I owned for 10 years. I have only been using this for a couple days. Bought this to dedicate to spices and used one to grind my Himalayan coarse salt into fine, fine popcorn salt. Worked like a charm. Love these things for so many uses. I also grow, wash, and dry my own herbs, stevia, etc. Then grind or powder them in my handy little coffee grinder. Works good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Worst kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: Worst kitchen gadget I had bought. Broke within two months of purchase. All I was using it was for ginger and green chili.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Electric Spices and Coffee Grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I have been watching lots of You-Tube cooking shows and always they used a small metal grinder/blender to grind dry spices as well as blend tomatoes. This product has both! I can grind the spices then switch out the cups to blend whatever vegetable is required in the recipe. For the size and price, it is well worth it! I no longer have to take out my huge blender when this is extremely compact and fits in a drawer. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sameena

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder! Don't overfill & you won't have problems
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Tried other grinders & this one is the best I've used so far. So east to use & wash. Not noisy. Perfect for grinding things lile flaxseeds. It's really important you don't overfull the container...otherwise, you'll get a mess (which is what I think happened with the people who noted spillage.)
customer_reviews.author: Beth Mc.

customer_reviews.title: Super fast Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Grinds spices, even anise seed and shell into powder. Impressive. Both the dry and wet spice feature. Only had it a few days if it last a couple of years, and I remember, I can write about the actual quality of the product. Hopefully this company has more integrity than many others that sell their souls for a couple of pennies in manufacturing savings. We’ll see....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Indian cooking !
customer_reviews.text: This Chulux spice and coffee grinder is very efficient for day to day cooking.. It comes with two attachments, the dry jar is perfect to pulse 4 garlic pods or 6 cashew nuts or only one tablespoon of spices needed for one day/meal curries or sambar . It comes with a wet jar that is perfect to make small quantity of chutney needed for one day/meal idly/dosa side dish for 4 people..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for grinding spices
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to grind spices and it works great for it. It does unfortunately have to be hand washed and you have to be careful to limit the amount of time the motor is in use. With those minor limitations, though, it works great as a spice grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Moya37

customer_reviews.title: Same as any grinder
customer_reviews.text: It’s nothing special it does what any grinder would do. I wanted a fine grind but this doesn’t do that it does what my chopper/grinder can do. I was not happy so I returned it
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Wet & dry grinding as claimed.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this little wonder. I have been looking for a product for wet grinding for a while especially coriander and mint condiment. I wanted something small as I already have a food processor and mixer. So far have tried spinach soup, garlic, chilly paste and dry spices as well and it works well. Cleaning can be done easily by putting the jar under running water.
customer_reviews.author: Amrit

customer_reviews.title: i wasted my money on other brands
customer_reviews.text: I really wish i had bought this before now. Wasted my money with other brands. I use it for coffee and grinding herbs and making powders out of dehydrated fruit and vegetables. Works fantastic with individual grinding cups that can be taken off and washed excellent excellent product I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: bethany a mackey

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect coffee grinder for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect coffee grinder for me! I just need to use it everyday and it is very easy to grind the coffee beans that I need everyday. It only needs a few seconds for the beans to grind into fresh coffee powder instead of using the ones that are already ready for drink. In my opinion I like fresh coffee everyday so this grinder is perfect for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: It's a good concept.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted around 2 weeks. It's a good concept...except the motors needs to be more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: We cook a lot. A lot means really a lot of variety rather than quantity. We have several 3 mixer grinders with multiple attachments. They all work well. But the press and operate function of this unit beats out all other appliances. The two jars are perfect. It should be noted though that for the wet grind, you need to figure out the right water to solid ratio to grind. That will depend on user experience. Pros: Super convenient. Cons: None.
customer_reviews.author: vmarata

customer_reviews.title: Smoked in about 15secs of non-stop use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when it worked. But broke down with smoke coming out of the bottom after about 15 secs of nonstop use, on one ocassion, about 3 months from purchase l. Although, the manufacturer gives a 30sec limit, lack of overheating protection turns this into paperweight quite quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Aniket

customer_reviews.title: Decent spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a spice grinder since we do not drink coffee. I used it on some whole pepper to make a large quantity for use in lots of recipes. It did a decent job, but took a little longer than I thought it should to get the desired result. All in all, its a good little "grinder" as it really isnt a grinder, but more of a small blender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for chopping nuts, and grinding coffee. Well, it works a little too good. It menz's knots and grinds the coffee too much. It is also very uneven how it grinds so I have some powder and course at the same time. Unfortunately, I was out of commission for about six weeks and missed my deadline to return
customer_reviews.author: Calif Karen

customer_reviews.title: Junk..Don't waste your money Had two both broke
customer_reviews.text: The worst ever. Ordered one burned out second day. Ordered replacement was sent by Amazon second day. Used second one twice it burned out. Now have two that are useless and didn't have time to package so I'm out 65.00 for junk. Buy a ninja and be done. If you don't need my mistake you will be sorry too.
customer_reviews.author: gatorba8

customer_reviews.title: Love this blender
customer_reviews.text: I use it to chop onion, tomato and garlic into paste and it works perfectly. Also good on grinding spices. Easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: #1 AMZN Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice grinder chopper
customer_reviews.text: Best mini grinder chopper I've owned. I love the two different bowls for different food. We've primarily used this for coffee grounds but also use the chopper cup for herbs from time-to-time. Nice compact size and strong motor to do the job well.Satisfied purchase, I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Useful,cute grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder mainly to grind peanuts, soybeans, red beans and sesame seeds into powder. Then I want to eat it and soak it in boiling water. When I used this grinder, it was really good, it was very fast, and the powder was very delicate. If everyone likes to take things and mix them into a paste like me, I completely recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Carlota

customer_reviews.title: Great for salad dressings and emulsions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for wet grinding Indian masala. While it does a decent job for that purpose, it is definitely better for making spice powders and excellent for making salad dressings. It whipped the oils so well it was a very good creamy dressing. Very simple to use and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my mother and she loves this product. The grinder and chopper absolutely works and at such a reasonable price. My mom use it for grinding black pepper, almonds and making chutney. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: upasana

customer_reviews.title: Leaky lid
customer_reviews.text: It can’t be used for any wet grinding / chopping as it leaks out of the lid, making it messy. You have to hold down the lid to grind but it doesn’t seal well enough . Even grinding coffee will be messier than other grinders. If only the lid closed completely , this would be a great product
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Not for chutneys... only for powders
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make Indian chutneys. Blade is good. However, I would recommend magic bullet over this. I need to clean the inner motor area for every grind... water used for chutney goes into the area. It cannot take more load... gets struck every now and then. I need to stir the content frequently for a proper grind session. Good for making powders though. Magic bullet is perfect for chutneys!
customer_reviews.author: Hari Vana

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make almond flour and I have been so happy using it, it's easy, durable and quick. I especially like that there's a dusting brush included, makes cleaning the blades safer.
customer_reviews.author: quiet kat

customer_reviews.title: Two separate jars for dry & wet grinding, compact
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute and perfect for those looking for mini grinder/mixer. Comes with two separate cups with different blades for dry and wet stuffs. I use it for basically grounding coffee beans & for making ginger garlic tomato paste for Indian cooking. But this is not sturdy. I have just used two times. Hoping that it will last long.
customer_reviews.author: Sudeshna

customer_reviews.title: Not good for grinding
customer_reviews.text: Although the product description says, it can be used for grinding, it did not work for peanuts and even garlic. Would not recommend if you need for grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Swanand T.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of parts not fitting correctly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 3/7/19, used it three or four times then the blade becomes unattached from the bolt so I think too myself no problem I'll just screw it back together but guess what the bolt is too wide for the threads of the blade so it wont stay attached.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I love this grinder!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grinder!! This is actually my second time buying this...I moved and left the previous one. Works great on all the spices I've ever used. Isn't so fast/powerful that you can't control what you're doing. I often mix various herbs/spices to make a particular blend and come out with great results. The little brush is very handy. Is equally great on coffee as well. I haven't used this on fresh herbs as of yet but I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Functional and effective compact product.
customer_reviews.text: This little product is excellent ! My mom loves it, she used it to grind multiple indian spices as well as aromatic pastes. The leaking on the side is a little messy, but it's easy to wipe the machine and the detachable cups are very convenient to do two different applications at the same time. Of course like all small machines, sufficient cooling time must be provided before using it again. Even still, it is recommended !
customer_reviews.author: Rey TS

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Best little grinder we’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for grinding peppercorns and other spices. Works beautifully. Cleans up nicely. Love the two choices for chopping and grinding. Will be back for another for grinding our dried almond pulp into super fine flour...no doubt this guy will do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: KMBmom

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder with a strong motor and easily removable grinding bowl to empty the fresh ground beans. Solid,simple and fast grinder. Put beans in, put see thru cover on,and push down the cover. High speed blade takes a few seconds to grind up beans to the desired grind. Couldn't be easier. Sturdy,solid unit. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: lydia

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that I’d need to take out a small business loan to buy enough of these Chinese knock-offs of a Japanese product to grind 1 ounce of air. This thing burned up so fast i thought the cord was a fuse!! I unsuccessfully tried to grind dried peppers (with the stems removed) to make a pepper shake. As you can probably tell it didn’t work for a total of 1min before it smoked. The burnt plastic and motor smell was not conducive to a great finished herb product. I wouldn’t recommend this to an enemy let alone my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for grinding dehydrated vegetables and fruits into powders for cooking and preserving! I am impressed with the quality, clean up and capacity of the cups! Very glad I chose this brand over others I have considered.
customer_reviews.author: Brandee Howell

customer_reviews.title: Burns even for use as much as 2 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Worst product. In the very first use it got burnt and I had to return! You get what you pay for. It's made with very cheap material, although it looks good at first. When you use it even for a little longer time -about 2 minutes it so, you'll start getting a burning smell from inside. I had to then return it. The day it burnt was a nightmare. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working first day, but prompt refund
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product, but it stopped working the first day and smelt of burnt plastic, even after carefully​ following instructions on not using it for more than 20 seconds at a time. 2 stars because​ I received a prompt refund when I talked to the seller.
customer_reviews.author: System Spyder

customer_reviews.title: It smoked!
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to grind spices and onions and it started spewing smoke in less than a minute of grinding. I have another similar grinder that I use only for grinding coffee beans and it has worked really well for several years. So, I'm not impressed, I'm afraid. I will have to buy another now...
customer_reviews.author: Kapsy

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This is a great little grinder! It does the job quickly and quietly (when compared to other grinders I've owned). I like a finer grind on my coffee beans and it takes only seventeen seconds and I have the perfect grind for my tastes. It also seems to be well built. Both tubs are stainless steel with stainless steel blades and are safe to go in the dishwasher, which makes cleaning them a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because it didn't work for what I was using it for. I am grinding pigments which are softer than coffee beans and it got bogged down. Also the powder ran to the top and spilled out.
customer_reviews.author: Zig Top Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item August 1, 2019. By Sept 25th the bolt for the grinder cup which was only used once (never had a need grind anything until tonight) came off. I thought I can just screw it back on and call it a night, but no. Couldn’t do it because the threading to hold the bolt been has been sheared. So much for the quality! So, suffice to say while I like using this chopper, I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: ProudCatMommy

customer_reviews.title: Rubber/silicone bottom is flimsy and breaks while running the grinder. Not a great investment.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is awful. The rubber/silicone portion in the bottom of the chopper broke after two uses. Since I wanted this for mostly coffee and spice grinding I didn't care too much. The other one for dry grinding also broke recently after a few months of use. All I ever did was grind a couple tablespoons of coffee beans at a time, and whole spices maybe twice, ever. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Deepika

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job well for the price. Compact and low noise.
customer_reviews.text: We grind some Tim Horton's original blend and it taste fine. No complaint here. We also have an teething infant so we used it to grind some dry fried pork as solid food. So FYI you can do that.One pleasant surprise is it's not loud. There is no high pitch noise to wake up the baby. Build quality is what I would call solid from early impression.
customer_reviews.author: Joan H

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for dry and liquid grinding.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy to choose the right coffer grinder. I tried for grinding the spices Great. Also tried grinding spices with liquid To make past. Grind very fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Yousuf

customer_reviews.title: Do it all grinder
customer_reviews.text: The grinder come with two bowl with blade, one grind hard but and spice while the other chop herbs or soft fruit into paste like food. We use it for chilly pepper, and the other day my mom use it to grind roasted rice. Work pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: H. Phan

customer_reviews.title: The motor smokes and stops working
customer_reviews.text: I received the parcel an hour ago, the first time I used it, the motor smoked, stopped working, grinded paprika, I had to use my juicer to continue working Maybe this is an accident
customer_reviews.author: CHENG

customer_reviews.title: user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that the cups are removal for emptying and washing. my last one was all one piece. very hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: birdwoman

customer_reviews.title: Cheating
customer_reviews.text: I bought it see review and feel better to decide but this item is worst for me after buy it I use only one time 30 second only after that stop it . It shows one year warranty but no body response wel I told about what happen but telling tidious way to send back I do not recommend that things to anybody Be careful to take decision to buy it
customer_reviews.author: Rama K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, quiet
customer_reviews.text: I've used this electric grinder several times now. It is a great mill. The capacity is a good size, and seems well made. I would definitely recommend this grinder. I use it for coffee and it is super!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my aunt and she uses the grinder attachment for spices like black peppercorns and cardomom pods. The grinder attachment is used for more batter/chutney like consistency. She is very satisfied by the product efficiency. However, I did notice the manual mentions that the appliance comes with a brush but there wasn't one in the box.
customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and easy to clean, it take only a few second to grind spices.
customer_reviews.author: Eshop13

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: It works really well as a spice grinder and it's really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: spockkilledpunk

customer_reviews.title: Flushed my money down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: Stoped working after first use then got replacement and worked 2-3times.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Grinding
customer_reviews.text: I like this product since it is so quick. Used this product to grind nuts and spices, chop vege like carrots, spinach...
customer_reviews.author: ALJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for very light loads.
customer_reviews.text: Gets heated. Sometimes there's a burning smell even for low duration of use <30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Soumyananda Goswami

customer_reviews.title: Buy only if you will use for very lite duty
customer_reviews.text: This item design is flawed unless you will use it for very lite duty tasks. The part on the cup that attaches to the motor is a light rubber that got easily worn with medium light usage.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Szkolnik

customer_reviews.title: Chops and Grinds Beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful machine! I use the cross blades to chop nuts and the straight blade to reduce herbs to dust, if I like. Powerful little machine. Nothing complicated. Quick and easy. I couldn't want more.
customer_reviews.author: Peaceful Person

customer_reviews.title: It's great for grinding .  The chopper is not good  big mess of anything you chop in it.
customer_reviews.text: It does make a big mess when you chop anything. Plus the chopper is too small for any amount of food you want to chop. Nice that it grinds and is stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Multifunction Grinder - Good Grinder but not so good Chopper
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased this was to utilize grinder and chopper multifunctions. The grinder is well performing but chopper leaks and is not much useful. I reached out to the seller and they asked me to follow instructions. No much help. If you are only looking for grinder there may be more powerful single function grinders out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dipali Amin

customer_reviews.title: Very food quality for the price , highly recommend after trying others
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of having separate chopper & separate grinder.I haven't had any motor problems and I love it! I bought it mainly for paste making / spice grinding for Indian cooking when I found that my large blender couldn't cope with small quantities. It's reasonably easy to clean and it works well.Essential kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: BC_Ch

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Pleasants surprising to find great quality and it works very well. Like the two stainless bowls and the safety holds. Great
customer_reviews.author: Redwood

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality product. Used it for couple of times to grind with both jars. Then it stoped grinding. Motor coupler came out, there is no way it can be fitted again, screw does not work to fit it. The product was delivered without external packing and seal. I am not sure whether it is a new or used product. I need to buy one more.
customer_reviews.author: Srini

customer_reviews.title: This is just awful
customer_reviews.text: When I used it, the liquid was everywhere. And worst still food was just spinning and nothing got grounded. This was the wet experience. For dry I used to powder Dulce, dried seaweed. Sadly there was no powder at the end. Can I still return it? I don’t have any packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for small quantities. Lid difficult to align sometimes. Broke in less than a year. No warranty/ no customer service/ no amazon support. Primarily used wet grinder to grind ginger/ garlic/ chilies. The pieces would always get stuck in the blades. Had to cut small pieces and only one at a time otherwise it wouldn’t work properly.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: This machine broke.
customer_reviews.text: The machine broke. I used it only one time. I tried to it second time, it did not work. I heard strange sound with burnt smell. I strongly do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: pagpurin

customer_reviews.title: very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: So far, this grinding machine has been perfect. My wife really likes it not as loud as it used to be. At this time, I did not complain. It has been in use for more than a month. My favorite is the stainless steel cup. No plastic can be ground in coffee. Still very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Zhuowen Liao

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for grinding coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: This works well for grinding small amount of coffee beans at a time. I’ve also used it to grind sesame seeds, and it turned out fine. It is pretty simple to set it up and easy to clean. You could use it with either wet or dry ingredients, which I thought is convenient. This little grinder is actually useful and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lejesam

product_meta.title: CHULUX Electric Spices and Coffee Grinder with 2.5 Ounce Two Detachable Cups for Wet/Dry Food,Powerful Stainless Steel Blades and Cleaning Brush
feature_bullets: Grinding Function:this all-purpose 200W grinder is a must-have item for any kitchen(120V).
One Touch Operation:Safety switch system makes it only operate when top cover is safely in place.Easy Push-Down operation with transparent lid.
Easy Cleaning:The removable cup with stainless steel blade.Dishwasher clean up cup as the separate part from actual grinder.
Unique Feature and Purpose:With different grinding time to adjust bean’s fineness,non-slip rubber feet ensure stability.
The grinder come with ETL certification to ensure the quality.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars761 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
